private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E
agent_1.goal: Cooperate with the other agents to achieve the global Tower of Hanoi goal configuration.

private_information: I can move disks: F, G, H, I, J
agent_2.goal: Cooperate with the other agents to achieve the global Tower of Hanoi goal configuration.

private_information: I can move disks: K, L, M, N, O
agent_3.goal: Cooperate with the other agents to achieve the global Tower of Hanoi goal configuration.

private_information: I coordinate the agents and integrate their move sequences
I must produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' move sequences, verify they respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and agent restrictions, and produce the PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward plus the final ordered list of primitive moves.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
Disks are labeled A through O where A is the smallest and O is the largest.
Initial configuration: left peg from top to bottom is A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg from top to bottom is A, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Middle peg from top to bottom is B. Right peg is empty.

Rules: Only the top disk of any peg can be moved. A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk. Each primitive move must be executed by the agent that is allowed to move that disk. A valid primitive move must be expressed exactly in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.
Agents are limited to moving specific disks: agent_1 may move A B C D E, agent_2 may move F G H I J, agent_3 may move K L M N O.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can move only disks A, B, C, D, E. Do not produce PDDL. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Ensure every move respects Tower of Hanoi rules and that you only move disks listed in your private information. Your moves should aim to help achieve the global goal configuration specified in the environment public information.
moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Public information: There are three pegs left middle right. Initial configuration left top to bottom A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O. Goal configuration left top to bottom A C D E F G H I J K L M N O and middle top to bottom B. You can move disks A B C D E only. Produce the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Use the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not assume other agents' moves beyond the restrictions. Keep moves minimal and valid.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You can move only disks F, G, H, I, J. Do not produce PDDL. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Ensure every move respects Tower of Hanoi rules and that you only move disks listed in your private information. Your moves should aim to help achieve the global goal configuration specified in the environment public information.
moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Public information: There are three pegs left middle right. Initial configuration left top to bottom A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O. Goal configuration left top to bottom A C D E F G H I J K L M N O and middle top to bottom B. You can move disks F G H I J only. Produce the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Use the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not assume other agents' moves beyond the restrictions. Keep moves minimal and valid.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3. You can move only disks K, L, M, N, O. Do not produce PDDL. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Ensure every move respects Tower of Hanoi rules and that you only move disks listed in your private information. Your moves should aim to help achieve the global goal configuration specified in the environment public information.
moves.prompt: You are agent_3. Public information: There are three pegs left middle right. Initial configuration left top to bottom A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O. Goal configuration left top to bottom A C D E F G H I J K L M N O and middle top to bottom B. You can move disks K L M N O only. Produce the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Use the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not assume other agents' moves beyond the restrictions. Keep moves minimal and valid.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert in multi-agent PDDL suitable for the FastDownward planner. You must integrate the agents' primitive move lists, validate that the combined sequence follows Tower of Hanoi rules and agent restrictions, and produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Also provide the final ordered list of primitive moves. Keep actions distinct per agent by prefixing action names with the agent identifier.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the move lists from three agents. Verify that the combined ordered moves respect the rules: only top disks moved, no larger disk placed on smaller disk, and only allowed agents move each disk. If discrepancies exist, flag them and suggest corrections. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem compatible with FastDownward that models three agents as separate actors with actions corresponding to primitive moves agent_1_move, agent_2_move, agent_3_move. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>. Also emit the final ordered list of primitive moves that will solve the instance. Use the provided inputs: moves_agent_1 moves_agent_2 moves_agent_3.
